page.title: 02HOUSING/BUILDING CHIPPERFLD
page.content: Apart from original village there are 2 council estates and 3 residential areas.Buildings worthy of preservation for age or character are{PALE FARM}and {THE OLD FORGE}16th century listed buildings both in{"The Street".}Older buildings are mainly constructed of Chiltern Multi-Red Stocks and flints from Chiltern chalk-quarries.Facing the common is{MANOR HOUSE}an elegant 2-storey Jacobean brick building with Queen Anne facade,once lodge house to Royal Palace at Kings Langley.Recent development has been considerable,with infilling of scrubland and extensions of existing dwellings.Much attention is paid to ensuring that development harmonises with "Green Belt" village character.The character and increasing accessibility of London/other centres produces highly inflated house prices. { }
